intro: Trichinium gnaphaloides, commonly known as the silverleaf sedum, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a succulent species characterized by its fleshy, gray-green leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Trichinium gnaphaloides is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance in landscaping.
